text: Former stripper turned reality TV star with huge Instagram following becomes first female rapper to top US singles chart since Lauryn Hill Her rise to fame has been described as both a modern fairytale and the millennial manifestation of the American dream. This week Cardi B, social media star turned musician, became the first female rapper in 19 years to reach No 1 on the US Billboard chart, knocking Taylor Swift off the top spot. It is a moment that has sent reverberations through the music industry, not only because it highlighted how few female rappers have topped the charts – before Cardi B, Lauryn Hill was the last to do it, with Doo Wop ( That Thing ) in 1998 – but also because of her distinctive rise to becoming a chart - topping rapper with song Bodak Yellow ( Money Moves
